### BIM Adoption at Tender Stages: Why Contractors Resist and What Poland Can Learn from the UK

::: {style="color: #666; font-size: 14px; margin: 12px 0;"}
üìÖ October 5, 2024 | ‚è±Ô∏è 20 min read
:::

::: {style="margin: 16px 0; color: var(--bim-charcoal); line-height: 1.6;"}
Deep analysis of BIM adoption barriers during tendering, comparing UK success (73% adoption) with Poland's challenges (8.9% contractor adoption). Comprehensive examination of economic, technical, organizational, and legal barriers, with actionable policy recommendations for Poland's 2030 mandate.
:::

::: {style="margin: 16px 0; padding: 16px; background: var(--bim-light-gray); border-radius: 6px;"}
**Key Insights:**
- 64.1 percentage point adoption gap between UK and Polish contractors
- $128,400-705,000 annual unrecovered BIM costs for active bidders
- Only 33% of UK projects share BIM at tender stage despite mandate
- Six priority action areas for Poland's transformation
:::
